course.subject: CENG
course.name: Bioproducts and Processing
course.description: Survey of bioproducts, cellular production hosts, production techniques (bioreactors), separation and purification processes, product formulation, product and process design.

reviews.author: Polly0929
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction to bioproducts and bioprocess
2. Biological basis: microbiology, metabolism, bioproducts, medium composition
3. Microbial growth kinetics and culture processes (batch, fed-batch, continuous, perfusion)
4. Bioreactor design & operation: agitation, scale up, aeration, heat removal, animal cell cultivation
5. Introduction to bio separation & cell lysis
6. Filtration & membrane separation
7. Chromatography
8. Centrifugation, precipitation and formulation
reviews.comment_teaching:
good and fun
Can email to ask question
reviews.comment_grading:
very good
I did not know how to do the whole exam. I just write something randomly on the paper. But still get B+ at the end
reviews.comment_workload:
very heavy workload
but it is ok if you find a good groupmate

reviews.author: SLL
reviews.title: BIOT students can try
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction to bioproducts and bioprocess
2. Biological basis: microbiology, metabolism, bioproducts, medium composition
3. Microbial growth kinetics and culture processes (batch, fed-batch, continuous, perfusion)
4. Bioreactor design & operation: agitation, scale up, aeration, heat removal, animal cell cultivation
5. Introduction to bio separation & cell lysis
6. Filtration & membrane separation
7. Chromatography
8. Centrifugation, precipitation and formulation
This course is a mix of biology, chemistry and chemical engineering. Chapter 2 is biology, while Chapter 3 to 8 is chemistry and chemical engineering topics.
Very practical for BIOT.
Need some calculations such as differentiation and integration. If you do not like calculations, DO NOT choose this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Marshal's teaching is always good. He makes the class interactive by telling jokes of himself. Attendance is not required, but he also recognizes you if you attend the class frequently. If he can recognize you, you will get 5% class performance, otherwise you lose 5%. He will ask your English name after add drop period. He also sometimes gives us some snacks such as chocolates and dried strawberries (his product).
Anything you do not understand just send him an email, including homework. He will reply you promptly.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Class performance
10% Homework
20% 4 online Canvas quizzes outside class (open book and Internet)
30% 2 group project
35% Final examination (open book and Internet)
If you get the highest score in quizzes, you will get supermarket coupons.
Final examination is very difficult, but the mean is very low. There are lots of calculations, which requires you to understand the formula very well. Try to work hard in the final exam because most people have high marks in homework and quizzes.
Workload is high compared to LIFS courses, but Marshal gives generous A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is a bit high, there are have 5 quizzes (exclude the lowest score), 4 homework, 2 group project (4 people) and 1 final exam. The group project requires you to use a bioreactor to ferment something. You can ferment anything as long as you do fermentation. You do not need to purify the products. You also need to do a literature review to introduce a fermentation product and make a video and 800 words essay. Finally, attend a Q&A session. During the Q&A session, you can have some snacks and drinks.

reviews.author: Bohr
reviews.title: CBME Course
reviews.comment_content:
1. Introduction of Bio-processing
Overview of Bioproducts and biotechnology
Review of microbiology + genetic engineering
Bioenergetics

2. Bioreactor Design
Microbial Kinetics
Bioreactors [Batch, Fed-Batch and CSTR]

3. Bio-separation [Downstream processing]
Introduction [selection and design]
Membrane-based separation
Sedimentation and Centrifugation
Liquid Chromatography
Drying and Formulation
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is nice and always talk jokes and his past experiences in university during the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Homework (Total: 5)
15% Group Project [2-3 person per group]
35% Mid-term
40% Final Exam
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is ok.
The homework is useful for revision.

Mid-term project is to present the information of chosen bioproduct such as information of company, upstream and downstream processing, market competitors
